name: Music: Music Creation for the PlayStation
summary: In 1998, Codemasters and Jester Interactive created Music: Music Creation For The PlayStation―a video game that simulated an authentic music-making experience on the popular gaming console. Released solely for PlayStation, the music-making program provided gamers and music enthusiasts with 50 pre-recorded riffs and 300 sampled instruments to develop loops and mix them on a 16-track sequencer―along with an array of other audio editing options
